Washington. D. C.
May 11th /73
My Dear Sister
Lulu sent me your letter I was ever so glad to hear fr
[... truncated ...]
 probaly be liveing in Westchester P.A. so write me there
Your affectionate Brother
Will
Love to all

Diego.
Verdad es, muy grande que yo no quisiera, ni hablar, ni dormir ni hoir, ni querer.
Sentirme e
[... truncated ...]
a de mi gran amor.
F.
Cada momento, il es mi niño, mi niño nacido, cada talito, diario, de mi misma.

Temple, Sep. 28. 1739.
If wishes could turn to realities, I would fling down my law books, and sup w
[... truncated ...]
 Lyra dic furore
Gesties, quando hâc reducem sodalem
Glauciam gaudere simul videbis
Meque sub umbrâ?

In vain to me the smiling mornings shine,
And reddening Phoebus lifts his golden fire:
The birds in 
[... truncated ...]
birds complain.
I fruitless mourn to him that cannot hear,
And weep the more because I weep in vain.

Spesso il male di vivere ho incontrato:
era il rivo strozzato che gorgoglia,
era l’incartocciarsi de
[... truncated ...]
vina Indifferenza:
era la statua nella sonnolenza
del meriggio, e la nuvola, e il falco alto levato.

Mi Diego:

Espejo de la noche.
Tus ojos espadas verdes dentro de mi carne.  Ondas entre nuestras man
[... truncated ...]
ra recorre todo el
espacio y llega a mis células que son mis astros y va a los tuyos que son mi luz.

Those hours, that with gentle work did frame
The lovely gaze where every eye doth dwell,
Will play t
[... truncated ...]
rs distill'd, though they with winter meet,
Leese but their show; their substance still lives sweet.

Erano i capei d’oro a l’aura sparsi
che ’n mille dolci nodi gli avolgea,
e ’l vago lume oltra misura
[... truncated ...]
leste, un vivo sole
fu quel ch’i' vidi: e se non fosse or tale,
piagha per allentar d’arco non sana.

NEULINGGASSE 26/14
1030 WIEN
TEL. 73 94 015
                                            5. April 197
[... truncated ...]
her"?
Aber wenn nicht, ist mir Alles recht!

               Mit herzlichen Grüßen,

Stella Musulin ´

From the Rev. R Rice, Chaplain on board the Vulture - to Mr. Dewar

Buyukdere - Dec. 30/56

My dear 
[... truncated ...]
h those whom the Lord has been pleased this heavily to afflict -
I am Sir
Yours sincerely Richd Rice

Diego.
Verdad es, muy grande que yo no quisiera, ni hablar, ni dormir ni hoir, ni querer.
Sentirme e

F.
